title: How to Make Pignoli Cookies

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C) and spray a baking sheet with nonstick cooking spray.
Cover the sprayed baking sheet with parchment paper.
steps.description: This will help the parchment paper to adhere because it tends to curl up during longer baking times.

steps.headline: Combine the almond paste, sugar and eggs in a large bowl, using a flat plastic spatula or wooden spoon.
Roll the dough into a log on a clean surface sprinkled with a little flour.
Break the log into balls of dough that are about 2" (5 centimeters) in diameter using your hands.
steps.description: Alternatively, you can scoop the dough with a cookie scoop to form balls of dough.

steps.headline: Place the dough balls onto the baking sheet, leaving about 1-1/2" (4 centimeters) of space around each cookie.
Press a pinch of pine nuts onto the surface of each cookie, flattening it a little.
Bake for 40 minutes or until the cookies are golden brown.
Remove the cookies from the oven and allow them to cool on the stovetop for 2 minutes.
Remove the cookies from the baking sheet using a spatula and place the cookies on wire racks to cool.

text: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C) and spray a baking sheet with nonstick cooking spray.  Cover the sprayed baking sheet with parchment paper. This will help the parchment paper to adhere because it tends to curl up during longer baking times. Combine the almond paste, sugar and eggs in a large bowl, using a flat plastic spatula or wooden spoon.  Roll the dough into a log on a clean surface sprinkled with a little flour.  Break the log into balls of dough that are about 2" (5 centimeters) in diameter using your hands. Alternatively, you can scoop the dough with a cookie scoop to form balls of dough. Place the dough balls onto the baking sheet, leaving about 1-1/2" (4 centimeters) of space around each cookie.  Press a pinch of pine nuts onto the surface of each cookie, flattening it a little.  Bake for 40 minutes or until the cookies are golden brown.  Remove the cookies from the oven and allow them to cool on the stovetop for 2 minutes.  Remove the cookies from the baking sheet using a spatula and place the cookies on wire racks to cool.
